DOC.brief_summary: The aim study investigate six-weeks exercise intervention , 3 time per week Functional Re-adaptive Exercise Device ( FRED ) reduce non-specific mechanical low back pain adult age 18-60 .
DOC.brief_title: Newcastle Low Back Pain Intervention Study
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study investigate whether six-week FRED exercise intervention reduces low back pain ( LBP ) improve range related outcome . The objective study examine 1. whether FRED exercise reduce mechanical LBP ( low back pain ) ; 2. whether FRED exercise improve functional static balance people LBP ; 3. whether FRED exercise effect cross-sectional area ( CSA ) relevant lumbo-pelvic muscle ; 4. whether FRED exercise effect TrA ( Transversus Abdominis ) , LM ( Lumbar Multifidus ) , lumbar Erector Spinae , External Internal Oblique muscle activity function individual LBP ; 5. whether FRED exercise effect TrA internal oblique muscle thickness ; 6. rate muscle physiology change response FRED exercise people LBP ; 7. whether FRED exercise affect analgesic intake , need intervention physical activity level individual LBP ; 8. whether FRED exercise affect wellbeing every-day function people LBP ; 9. rate change level pain , wellbeing function ( incl . balance ) response FRED exercise people LBP .
DOC.criteria: Mechanical LBP 8 week longer Score < 15 FABQ Age 1860 Commitment take part study full duration Presence `` red flag '' indicative nonmechanical LBP Score > 15 FABQ indicator likely poor response solely physical approach treatment incl . seek compensation LBP Exercise contraindicate per Physical Activity Readiness Questionnaire Inability exercise safely FRED Pregnancy Surgery within previous nine month Difficulty exercise safely stand 30 min 3x/week Cardio/respiratory disease Neurological disorder BMI > 28 adipose tissue infringes ultrasound image intramuscular electrode placement
